instantiate.title: InstantiateMsg
instantiate.description: This struct describes the Msg used to instantiate in this contract.

pool_configs.description: IDs and configs of contracts that are allowed to instantiate pools

Addr.description:
A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.

FeeInfo.title: Description - This struct describes the Fee configuration supported by a particular pool type.

PoolConfig.description: This struct stores a pool type's configuration.

code_id.description: ID of contract which is used to create pools of this type

is_disabled.description: Whether a pool type is disabled or not. If it is disabled, new pools cannot be created, but existing ones can still read the pool configuration

is_generator_disabled.description: Setting this to true means that pools of this type will not be able to get added to generator

PoolType.description: This enum describes the key for the different Pool types supported by Dexter

execute.title: ExecuteMsg
execute.description: This struct describes the functions that can be executed in this contract.

oneOf.description: Executable only by `config.owner`. Facilitates updating `config.fee_collector`, `config.generator_address`, `config.lp_token_code_id` parameters.

Executable only by `pool_config.fee_info.developer_addr` or `config.owner` if its not set. Facilitates enabling / disabling new pool instances creation (`pool_config.is_disabled`) , and updating Fee (` pool_config.fee_info`) for new pool instances
Adds a new pool with a new [`PoolType`] Key.
Creates a new pool with the specified parameters in the `asset_infos` variable.
ProposeNewOwner creates an offer for a new owner. The validity period of the offer is set in the `expires_in` variable.
DropOwnershipProposal removes the existing offer for the new owner.
Used to claim(approve) new owner proposal, thus changing contract's owner

Asset.title: Description - This enum describes a asset (native or CW20).

info.description: Information about an asset stored in a [`AssetInfo`] struct

AssetInfo.description: This enum describes available Token types.

Binary.description:
Binary is a wrapper around Vec<u8> to add base64 de/serialization with serde. It also adds some helper methods to help encode inline.

This is only needed as serde-json-{core,wasm} has a horrible encoding for Vec<u8>. See also <https://github.com/CosmWasm/cosmwasm/blob/main/docs/MESSAGE_TYPES.md>.

Cw20ReceiveMsg.description: Cw20ReceiveMsg should be de/serialized under `Receive()` variant in a ExecuteMsg

Decimal.description:
A fixed-point decimal value with 18 fractional digits, i.e. Decimal(1_000_000_000_000_000_000) == 1.0

The greatest possible value that can be represented is 340282366920938463463.374607431768211455 (which is (2^128 - 1) / 10^18)

query.title: QueryMsg
query.description: Returns the [`PoolType`]'s Configuration settings  in custom [`PoolConfigResponse`] struct

oneOf.description: Config returns controls settings that specified in custom [`ConfigResponse`] struct
Returns boolean value indicating if the genarator is disabled or not for the pool
Returns the current stored state of the Pool in custom [`PoolInfoResponse`] struct
Returns the current stored state of the Pool in custom [`PoolInfoResponse`] struct

config.title: Description -  A custom struct for each query response that returns controls settings of contract.

next_pool_id.description: The next pool ID to be used for creating new pools
